casebody.data:
Bar Association of Greater Cleveland v. Nesbitt.

[Cite as Bar Assn, of Greater Cleveland v. Nesbitt (1982), 69 Ohio St. 2d 108.]

(D.D. No. 81-10 — Decided February 3, 1982.) *109Mr. William J. Coyne, Mr. A. Richard Valore and Mr. Seymour R. Brown, for relator. Mr. Milt Schulman, for respondent. Per Curiam.

After a careful examination and review of the record in this cause, this court concurs with the findings and conclusion of the board that respondent violated DR 5-103(A) and DR 5404(A).

It is the judgment of this court that respondent be suspended from the practice of law for a period of one year.

Judgment accordingly.

Celebrezze, C. J., W. Brown, Sweeney, Locher, Holmes, C. Brown and Krupansky JJ., concur.
